sub_title: 🌟 Unleashing Brilliance in Communications & Management | Strategically Thriving, No Matter the Terrain 🚀
summary:
🚀 Ready to Empower Success with Passion and Strategy 🚀

I bring 3.5+ years of conquering challenges and nurturing growth. My journey spans project leadership, sales, and corporate administration, thriving in diverse environments. Armed with an MBA from the University of New Brunswick, Canada, I exceed targets and build unbreakable client bonds. Outside work, I embrace nature, music, and family moments.

As the former MBA cohort president, I ignite cross-functional teams and empower others as a mentor and speaker. Adaptable and self-aware, I thrive in new challenges, guided by continuous learning. Beyond work, I'm committed to impacting youth, women in leadership, and the underprivileged.

Now, I'm eager to embrace the Netherlands' vibrant communications and management scene. Let's redefine success together. Connect with me for virtual or in-person discussions. Excited to embark on this journey with you.

Looking forward to our chat!

treasury_media.title: UNB Talks: Faculty Conversations - Management
treasury_media.description: 🎬 Excited to be a part of this insightful video! 🌟 Watch as I share my journey and experiences in the communications and management field. 🚀 #CareerJourney #Communications #ManagementInsights

treasury_media.description: Excited to be featured in Huddle Today's article about UNB's Faculty of Management!  Sharing how this program has empowered students like me to become an integral part of New Brunswick's permanent workforce.  #UNBManagement #CareerSuccess #EmpoweredStudents

profile_positions.title: MBA First Year Representative

profile_positions.description: As part of my New Venture Creation and Entrepreneurship course at UNB, I was a part of the team developing a business plan for Threetwoone. fun. The product is a multiplication story card deck for children in the autism or ADHD spectrum. We helped with all aspects like identifying the Value proposition, conducting market research and assessment, undertook customer interviews, competitor analysis, business model, marketing and sales strategy, product cycle, company timeline, exit strategy, pricing models, and risk assessment for the business. The final outcome was that the founder has now successfully entered the market and is still in touch with the team to update us about the milestones achieved!
profile_positions.title: Business Consultant - Student

profile_positions.description:
The University of New Brunswick launched Catalyst, a program to help support communities as they adapted to and recovered from the COVID-19 pandemic.
The program gave New Brunswick businesses access to some of UNB’s brightest and most talented students for assistance in immediate COVID-19 recovery and long-term strategy development.
As Student Lead, I had the opportunity to work with UP+GO.
The intent of the program is to increase the number of females interested in STEM, entrepreneurship, and leadership roles as they explore career options and future post-secondary education. This is done through experiential learning with a curriculum that builds work/life skills. 
The previous face-to-face process needed to be migrated online due to COVID-19. In this role, I assisted with redesigning the program to be delivered online and remotely. This included re-designing the curriculum, determining the delivery platform, ensuring delivery was interesting and engaging, and researching which businesses were currently engaging in tours and for those that were, ensuring social distancing protocols were in place. Additionally., I curated customer personas and also created files charting a plan for the business to increase its social media presence on different platforms.
profile_positions.title: Student Lead - Catlayst project

volunteer_experiences.role: Art and Crafts Coordinator, Retreat Coordinator
volunteer_experiences.description: Yu4C is a religious group which aims to get the youth of the Nation closer to Christ and conducts retreats and activities with the same aim in mind.

Volunteered for a program called 'Baalkalakar' which was a day of fun for children from the economically weaker section of society. We organized games and food for them and gave them some goodies as well. This was an initiative as a part of the joy of giving week.
Participated as a Mohiniattam dancer with about 800 other dancers. Performed on stage and even the Prime Minister of the country came to see it.
